poem:
**At the Crossroads**

Humble the wood  
that cradles him—  
not high, not far,  
in sainted silence  
he lays as any  
man might,  
waiting under  
vaulted echoes.  
A whisper of  
basilica bells  
murmurs gently,  
as if to guide him,  
soft shadows  
dancing,  
among the marble  
stillness.  
At peace.
